Container.Overview:
I2P (Invisible Internet Project) is an anonymous network layer that allows for censorship-resistant, peer-to-peer communication. Access .i2p websites, communicate anonymously, and browse the hidden internet through this decentralized network.
After installation, access the router console at http://[IP]:7657 to configure your router. Configure your browser to use HTTP proxy [IP]:4444 for browsing .i2p sites. Allow 15-30 minutes for the router to integrate into the I2P network.

Config.Name: Router Console
Config.Description: Port for I2P Router Console web interface

Config.Name: HTTP Proxy
Config.Description: HTTP proxy port for browsing .i2p websites

Config.Name: HTTPS Proxy
Config.Description: HTTPS proxy port for secure .i2p browsing

Config.Name: IRC Proxy
Config.Description: IRC proxy for I2P IRC networks

Config.Name: Monotone Proxy
Config.Description: Monotone proxy port for distributed version control

Config.Name: I2P Data
Config.Description: Persistent storage for I2P configuration, router info, and tunnel settings

Config.Name: JVM Max Memory
Config.Description: Maximum JVM heap size (increase for high-traffic routers: 1g for heavy usage)
